sentences: Ta küsis, mis mina asjast arvan.
context: The Estonian verb 'küsima' primarily means 'to ask' or 'to inquire'. It can be used in various contexts: 1) To ask questions to obtain information (asking about time, origin, price, etc.), 2) To request something (work, help, support, money), 3) In an impersonal form meaning 'to be tested/questioned on a subject' in school, and 4) Figuratively used for when someone seeks or demands something. The verb is conjugated regularly in Estonian and appears in various tenses and moods.
